channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: Yale and Georgetown are among top U.S. universities being sued for allegedly illegally colluding to limit financial aid to students, amid continuing efforts to change college admissions practices #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/D82nnazGLJ
From Bruce Springsteen to John Legend and Stevie Nicks, the value of royalty revenue from music rights is skyrocketing https://t.co/9ZIwlnoCdF
U.S. shoppers are facing empty shelves at grocery stores as the fast-spreading Omicron variant and bad weather compound supply-chain issues and labor shortages #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/CDyHeaIgdG
One hundred times as powerful as Hubble, the James Webb telescope could show the face of Abraham Lincoln on a penny from 24 miles away https://t.co/4OObDXZ5tH
Buckingham Palace is pulling out the stops to celebrate Queen Elizabeth II’s 70 years on the British throne, with a series of events and a four-day public holiday https://t.co/rvzo1kKC2P
From @WSJopinion: Biden thought he was merely appealing to his base. He might have united the rest of the country against him, writes @Peggynoonannyc https://t.co/VoXpvJva5W
Novak Djokovic faces deportation from Australia after a court upheld a decision to cancel his visa, ending the tennis star’s bid to defend his Australian Open title https://t.co/Kyz5GUPFDV
Novak Djokovic was deported from Australia after a court upheld a decision to cancel his visa, ending the tennis star’s bid to defend his Australian Open title https://t.co/7ji0iivs4B
Tonga’s main island sustained significant damage after an undersea volcano erupted and triggered a tsunami https://t.co/N6Zu0vAZhB
Novak Djokovic faces deportation from Australia after a court upheld a decision to cancel his visa, ending the tennis star’s bid to defend his Australian Open title https://t.co/Xk7sDXZ4Ey

As soaring demand makes Covid-19 tests hard to come by, many people are skipping the tests altogether and going about their lives, unsure if they are infected or potentially exposing others https://t.co/2ntTZKnLTU

India has reached an agreement to supply the Philippines with the BrahMos antiship cruise-missile system. The deal comes as New Delhi boosts defense ties with the U.S. and its allies in response to China’s expanding military muscle. https://t.co/W13B5mQRsT
All hostages held at a synagogue in Colleyville, Texas, are “out alive and safe,” according to Texas Gov. Greg Abbott https://t.co/My092Kpc7g
Elon Musk wanted a law firm representing Tesla to fire an attorney who once worked for the SEC or it would lose the company's business, people familiar said https://t.co/bz7CfwSgsA

From @WSJopinion: When Biden’s administration elevates (or reduces) its domestic opponents to the status of a foreign enemy, the only winners are the real foreign enemies, writes @gerardtbaker https://t.co/nrELkPnwNk
New Zealand’s Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern said on Sunday that communications with Tonga have been difficult since the volcanic eruption. https://t.co/AddGEWC5Jy

Omicron is pushing Covid-19 hospital admissions among children to record levels, but doctors say the rise seems to reflect the large number of infections, rather than increased severity https://t.co/BIGwsFIJkQ
An hours-long standoff continues in Colleyville, Texas, where a man took several hostages at a local synagogue. One hostage has been released uninjured so far. https://t.co/fwQPsybyyj
Many nurses are rethinking their careers, exhausted by long hours and staffing shortages and traumatized by the magnitude of death from Covid-19 https://t.co/MMJnyCMNhP

An undersea volcano erupted near the Pacific nation of Tonga, sending tsunami waves crashing across the shore and people rushing to higher ground. Tsunami advisories were issued for Hawaii, Alaska and the U.S. Pacific coast. https://t.co/x8dQqSBAS8
A man apparently took hostages Saturday during services at a synagogue near Fort Worth and the FBI says crisis negotiators had been communicating with someone inside https://t.co/YKA1yR7hsM
TCM’s Ben Mankiewicz @BenMank77 remembers Sidney Poitier, who got his first Hollywood role in director Joseph Mankiewicz’s “No Way Out” in 1950. https://t.co/ZuvqmOhvrX
From @WSJopinion: There is no evidence so far that vaccines are reducing infections from the fast-spreading variant, write Luc Montagnier and Jed Rubenfeld https://t.co/qamPYhqJNL
Google, Amazon, Meta and Microsoft are building an empire under the ocean https://t.co/7Qexwn3EC7
There are 170 billion barrels of oil under the boreal forests in Alberta, Canada, one of the world's biggest reserves—and one of the dirtiest https://t.co/V0UvHzYQOg

A large fire at a Passaic, N.J., chemical plant continued to burn Saturday morning, as more than 200 firefighters battled to keep the flames away from chlorine stored at the facility https://t.co/RUNAfNVW6P
Elon Musk wanted a law firm representing Tesla to fire an attorney who once worked for the SEC or it would lose the company's business, people familiar said https://t.co/Lahao9gL6E
Saudi Arabia courted top companies to modernize its economy, but the business environment has grown more hostile and investors are souring on the oil-rich kingdom https://t.co/AjmCYwthKR

Martin Shkreli, the so-called pharma bro embroiled in a drug-pricing scandal, was banned for life from the pharmaceutical industry on Friday after a federal court found that he engaged in illegal and monopolistic behavior https://t.co/zX3J2JbHnm
From @WSJopinion: Joe Biden and Kamala Harris have become unpopular. It may be time for a change candidate, write @DouglasESchoen and Andrew Stein. https://t.co/SAtbct3N6Z
Essay: Why is Putin creating a crisis with Ukraine? Because he faces increasing unrest and disapproval at home, writes Russia expert Kathryn Stoner https://t.co/LVSQBUjl5q

An unvaccinated father in Montreal temporarily lost visitation rights to his 12-year-old son because he could expose the child to Covid-19, according to a recent court judgment https://t.co/EguueTHpLm

Russia said it is running out of patience with the U.S. and pressed for a response to its demands that the West stop encroaching on what the Kremlin views as its traditional sphere of influence https://t.co/aXqAOlIR1i
Netflix has increased the price for its monthly plans, with the standard plan for U.S. users now costing $15.49 a month, up from $13.99 https://t.co/NZHPCC40Gg
Americans can begin ordering free at-home rapid Covid-19 tests through a new government website on Jan. 19, senior Biden administration officials said https://t.co/ozeLXJ38os
White House says Russia is planning "false flag" operation as pretext for invading Ukraine https://t.co/nqRBPoTo1K
Google, Amazon, Meta and Microsoft are building an empire under the ocean https://t.co/js90uthWOw
Team USA advises athletes going to the Beijing Olympics to use burner phones as a precaution against possible surveillance https://t.co/O8mkNdzg8y

Australia’s decision to cancel tennis star Novak Djokovic’s visa for a second time was driven by fear that letting him stay could foster antivaccine sentiment during a surge in Covid-19 cases https://t.co/3pyrZYU9Ag
One America News Network faces a sharp reduction in audience after DirecTV, its largest distributor, said it plans to drop the conservative channel https://t.co/zoxrBkcCvy
"The Tragedy of Macbeth" is Joel Coen's solo directorial debut. We look back at the Coen Brothers catalogue to discuss frequently Shakespearean elements have popped up. https://t.co/FznXPoAwso

From @WSJopinion: Nobody knows whether Vladimir Putin will invade Ukraine, but it is increasingly clear that a divided and confused Western alliance doesn’t know how to deal with the challenge he poses, writes @wrmead https://t.co/3P5gYe647M

An unvaccinated father in Montreal temporarily lost visitation rights to his 12-year-old son because he could expose the child to Covid-19, according to a recent court judgment https://t.co/ODDqyzz07i

Martin Shkreli, the so-called pharma bro embroiled in a drug-pricing scandal, was banned for life from the pharmaceutical industry on Friday after a federal court found that he engaged in illegal and monopolistic behavior https://t.co/PbByNioEMu
Americans can begin ordering free at-home rapid Covid-19 tests through a new government website on Jan. 19, senior Biden administration officials said https://t.co/9SF3SRKNGE
From @WSJopinion: Biden thought he was merely appealing to his base. He might have united the rest of the country against him, writes @Peggynoonannyc https://t.co/ynK84v0Q4F
Dogecoin surged after Elon Musk tweeted that Tesla is accepting payment for some merchandise with the cryptocurrency, explains @ahirtens #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/R2f4VdrO5I

Google allegedly misled publishers and advertisers for years about the pricing and processes of its ad auctions, creating secret programs that deflated sales for some companies while increasing prices for buyers, a newly unredacted complaint says https://t.co/DM3hgoTjEu
Team USA advises athletes going to the Beijing Olympics to use burner phones as a precaution against possible surveillance https://t.co/jxanqT4FQp
U.S. retail sales dropped by 1.9% in December as Omicron and inflation surged. Sales grew by 16.9% last year on strong consumer demand. https://t.co/PXGus3RRtK
